Package javelin.controller.action.target

Class Target

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.action.Action
      • javelin.controller.action.target.Target
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ActionDescription
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpertiseAction, Fire
    public abstract class Target
extends Action
    Base class for all actions involving selecting an unit as target.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • calculatehitdc

        protected abstract int calculatehitdc​(Combatant active,
                                      Combatant target,
                                      BattleState s)
        Used for descriptive purposes.
        Returns:
        Minimum number the active combatant has to roll on a d20 to hit the target.

      • attack

        protected abstract void attack​(Combatant active,
                               Combatant target,
                               BattleState s)
        Called once a target is confirmed.

      • perform

        public boolean perform​(Combatant c)
        Description copied from class: Action
        Performs an action as the human player.
        Specified by:
        perform in class Action
        Parameters:
        c - Current unit.
        Returns:
        true if executed an action (successfully or not). Just return false if the player cannot use this action (AI-only).

      • checkengaged

        protected boolean checkengaged​(BattleState state,
                               Combatant c)
        By default uses BattleState.isengaged(Combatant)
        Returns:
        true if the active unit is currently engaded and should not be allowed to continue targetting.

      • checkhero

        protected void checkhero​(Combatant hero)
        Does nothing by default.
        Parameters:
        hero - Active unit.
        Throws:
        RepeatTurn

      • filtertargets

        protected void filtertargets​(Combatant active,
                             java.util.List<Combatant> targets,
                             BattleState s)
        By default only allows targeting enemies that are in line-of-sight.
        Parameters:
        targets - Remove invalid targets from this list. Beware of ConcurrentModificationException.

      • describehitchance

        public java.lang.String describehitchance​(Combatant active,
                                          Combatant target,
                                          BattleState state)
        Returns:
        Text with the name of the target and chance to hit.

      • prioritize

        public int prioritize​(Combatant c,
                      BattleState state,
                      Combatant target)
        A higher value means this should be selected first while browsing targets. TODO turn into dynamic instead?
